title: Channel Islands National Park: Fire Management
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Fire Management              Fire Management         Â    The park's fire management program provides leadership, direction, coordination, and support for park fire, aviation, and incident management. The wildland fire management policies of the National Park Service support Channel Islands National Park's resource management goals. The primary goals are to provide for firefighter and public safety, protect natural and cultural resources, and protect human developments from all wildland fire. For more information on the park's fire management, please contact the Fire Management Officer by phone at (805) 658-5730, or email at Fire Management Officer, or download the 2006 Channel Islands National Park Wildland Fire Management Plan  For information on local and national fire management resources, please visit:   National Park Service Fire and Aviation Management   Los Padres National Forest Fire and Aviation   California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection   Ventura County Fire Department   City of Ventura Fire Department
